pets

Class Pet

  • java.lang.Object
    • pets.Pet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cat, Dog, Dolphin, MockPet, Panda, Pony, Turtle

    public abstract class Pet
extends java.lang.Object
    The class representing pets

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pet

        public Pet(java.lang.String petName,
           java.lang.String petSpecies,
           Player petOwner,
           float meanWeight,
           int pettoiletNeedChange,
           int petHungerChange,
           int petPlayRoughness,
           int petTirednessChange,
           int petHealthChange,
           int petHappinessChange,
           java.util.Random rand)
        import java.util.Random; Constructs an instance of Pet. Uses random numbers to determine its favourite foods and toys as well as to set it's weight. The Random object parameter allows for testing of the methods involving random number generation.
        Parameters:
        petName - The name of the pet.
        petSpecies - Species of the pet.
        petOwner - Owner of the pet.
        meanWeight - Value used to calculate the weight of the pet(weight within 20% of this value.
        pettoiletNeedChange - Increase of pet's need for the toilet per day.
        petHungerChange - Increase of the pet's hunger per day.
        petPlayRoughness - How rough the pet is with toys.
        petTirednessChange - Increase of the pet's tiredness per day.
        petHealthChange - Decrease of the pet's health per day.
        petHappinessChange - Decrease of the pet's happiness per day.
        rand - The Random object used to generate random numbers.

      • isSick

        public boolean isSick()
        Determines whether the pet is sick or not.
        Returns:
        The sickness state of the pet as a boolean.

      • isMisbehaving

        public boolean isMisbehaving()
        Determines whether the pet is misbehaving or not.
        Returns:
        The misbehaviour state of the pet as a boolean.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the score associated with the pet.
        Returns:
        The score of the pet as an int.

      • feed

        public void feed(Food food)
        Have the pet consume some food. It's weight and happiness will increase according to the food consumed. A pet's favourite food provides double happiness. Remove the food from the player's foodList.
        Parameters:
        food - The food to be fed to the pet.

      • sleep

        public void sleep()
        Have the pet sleep. It's tiredness is reduced by 90. Reduces the remaining actions of the pet by 1.

      • play

        public void play(Toy toy)
        Have the pet play with a toy. It's happiness increases according to the type of toy. The toy's durability deacreases according to the roughness of the pet. If the durability is reduced to 0, the toy is broken and removed from the player's toyList.
        Parameters:
        toy - The toy being played with.

      • revive

        public boolean revive()
        If the owener has sufficient funds: Reset the pet's health to 100 and set alive and hasBeenRevived to true, reviving the pet. Charge the player for this and reduce their score. The pet can only be revived if it has not been revived in the past.
        Returns:
        true if the pet was revived, false otherwise.

      • die

        private void die()
        Kill the pet

      • toilet

        public void toilet()
        Have the pet go to the toilet. The pet's weight changed depending on how badly the pet needed the toilet, and its toiletNeed drops to 0.

      • punish

        public void punish()
        Punish the pet for its disobedience, stopping it misbehaving but reducing its happiness.

      • medicate

        public void medicate()
        Give the pet medicine for a cost, curing its sickness

      • generateDailyScore

        public void generateDailyScore()
        Calculates the daily score for the pet based off of its attributes + an offset to ensure the score goes up each day. Increases the total score of the pet by this amount.

      • rollForSickness

        private boolean rollForSickness()
        Determine if the pet will get Sick.
        Returns:
        true is the pet becomes sick, false otherwise.

      • rollForMisbehaving

        private boolean rollForMisbehaving()
        Determine if the pet will begin misbehaving.
        Returns:
        true if the pet begins misbehaving, false otherwise.

      • hasActionsRemaining

        public boolean hasActionsRemaining()
        Return whether the pet has any actions remaining which it can execute that day.
        Returns:
        Whether the pet has any actions remaining as a boolean.

      • randomEvent

        private void randomEvent()
        Checks to see if the pet is sick or misbehaving and if it is not, determines if it will get sick or begin to misbhave using rollForSickness() and rollForMisbehaving(). Also updates the pet's associated score and pet.daysSick / pet.daysMisbehaving if the pet is already sick or misbehaving at the start of a new day.

      • determineDeath

        private void determineDeath()
        Determines if the pet should die based off of it's current stat levels.

      • newDay

        public void newDay()
        Updates the status of the pet when the day is incremented. Also determines if random events of death

      • getFavouriteFood

        public Food getFavouriteFood()
        Return the pet's favourite food
        Returns:
        The pet's favourite food as a Food object.

      • getLeastFavToy

        public Toy getLeastFavToy()
        Return the pet's favourite food
        Returns:
        The pet's favourite food as a Food object.

      • setMisbehaving

        public void setMisbehaving()
        Make the pet misbehave for the purposes of testing.

      • makeSick

        public void makeSick()
        Make the pet sick for the purposes of testing.

      • getPlayRoughness

        public int getPlayRoughness()
        Return the pet's play roughness for testing.
        Returns:
        The play roughness of the pet as an int.

      • decreaseHealth

        public void decreaseHealth()
        Sets the health of the pet to zero to allow for testing.

      • killPet

        public void killPet()
        Kills the pet so the revive method can be tested.

      • getDaysMisbehaving

        public int getDaysMisbehaving()
        Getter for daysMisbehaving. Used purely for testing newDay().
        Returns:
        The days the pet has been misbehaving for as an int.

      • getDaysSick

        public int getDaysSick()
        Getter for daysSick. Used purely for testing newDay().
        Returns:
        The days the pet has been sick for as an int.
